  • All Known Subinterfaces:

    • Method Detail

      • processReturnOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document processReturnOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException

        The processReturnOrder API is used to associate return order to appropriate sales order(s) and compute refund amount.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exit:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPReturnOrderAssociationUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPGetReturnOrderPriceUE

        Events Raised: None

        Template Support: Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: Order is of return document type.

        Post-conditions: None

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Additional Information

        Association to Sales Orders

        This API uses getOrdersForReturn API to search for associable order(s) and associate return order lines to appropriate sales order lines. Additional order lines will be added to the return order if return order line quantity is more than associated sales order line's available quantity. A sales order line's available quantity is based on the pickable quantity from the INCLUDE_IN_DERIVED_ORDER transaction that produces a DocumenType equal to that of the return order's DocumentType. The new return order lines will be processed for association with other associable sales order lines that have enough available quantity. The unit price for the return item will be set to that on the associated order line unless the return order line has IsPriceLocked flag set to Y.

        Refund Calculation

        The API also calculates the refund amount for the return while associating to sales order(s). The charges on the associated sales order line or header are copied onto the return order for refund as below,
        • Charges which are marked as per unit are copied prorated based on quantity.
        • Any flat charges on sales order lines will be refunded when the line is fully returned.
        • Similarly any flat charges on the sales order will be refunded when the order is fully returned.

        The taxes will be merged based on ChargeCategory, ChargeName and TaxName. While merging, the Tax value will be added up and the TaxPercentage will be copied if both the taxes have the same percentage. Else the tax percentage will be set to 0. The above logic is not applicable if tax recalculation UE (com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateHeaderTaxUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE) are implemented.

        While copying the charges from sales order to return order line or header, charge breakup records will be formed which will provide information on what charges were copied from which sales order line or header and also the amount. The charge breakup will also contain information related to awards if the charge has awards related to it.

        Restocking Fee

        Restocking fee will be applied on the return order as configured in the validation rule. The total on the return order will give the refund amount.

        Return Policy

        After orders have been associated and the return has been priced, the configured return policies will be run against the return. Refer to the executeReturnPolicy API for details about each return policy.

        Refund Payments

        If processReturnOrder is run in non Inquiry mode, computeRefundPayments API will be internally called to copy all payment methods from the associated sales orders to return order. The existing payment methods on the return order will be removed.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
